                      Technical Case Study 3
•   Explain, “Best Estimates”

‘Best Estimate” – means a proposed, final, or designated best estimate of the amount of useful mineral or substance that the ICRB
estimates can economically and effectively recover from a mine development. The amount and quality of economic mineral recoverable by
a mine development project from its properties is subject to technical and commercial risk. Technical risk is the risk that the company
cannot extract a sufficient amount of economic mineral from the mine. Commercial risk is the risk that the company cannot obtain an
appropriate economic benefit from the sale of that economic mineral. The amount of an estimate of economic mineral that the ICRB
Email 3:
Dear Linda,
         Please fax back the shipping schedule for the 5,000MT caustic soda shipment. I am at the office.              Thank you
                  Maria


                               ICRB Estimates vs. Reserves
             Business case estimates as provided by the ICRB. The business case is based on an estimation of amount and value of the economic
             mineral recoverable by the mine development. Although the ICRB estimates the amount of economic mineral that can be recovered,
             the ICRB estimates the best estimate of the amount of economic mineral recoverable is just an estimate. The best estimate is not a
             “reserve” as defined in National Instrument 43-101. The ICRB’s estimate is a calculated probability of the anticipated metal
             recoverable by the mine development. Economic mineral estimates are subject to technical and commercial risk.
             Determining the

             Mary

  1. This email was sent in reply to the previous email.
  2. Email 2 was sent to Linda.

Is there an automated reply sent when an email is not received by Linda or John (who is the intended recipient)? How will you track the case manually?

To answer this question, let’s imagine that both emails are sent at the same time.

In this example, we send two emails to Linda from John at the same time. They reach Linda at approximately the same time.

As we know, we often use a three-day buffer in our automated emails. This gives us time to confirm that an email is received by the intended recipient before sending an automated reply.

## Backscatter

The email sequences above were generated from pre-written message templates. Backscatter is a technique in which an auto-generated response is sent to the sender, without human intervention. This sort of reply looks as though the recipient is interacting with the sender.

To prevent backscatter, you can check each individual email for backscatter, or implement tools that stop messages from being sent automatically to a human.

In the email examples above, an auto-receipt would be sent to Ana. The auto-reply would say something like:

Thank you for your email. It has been forwarded to our assigned coffee broker, Mr. Hardy. Mr. Hardy will contact you soon to arrange the details of this order.

The rates of the carriers would change at different times based on many factors, including demand and supply. In fact, there is also a cap on rates by the International Maritime Organisation (IMO) due to the deep-sea shipping market becoming an oligopoly, with only a few shipping companies dominating the global shipping market, as is the case with many industries today.
